answers: b"The nature of reality conforms to our perception- and we are real- but reality itself isn't necessarily real. Gnostic views were close but the truth is far more bizarre. Squid-like creatures remain near us and feed off of energy. We are powerful- but very alien to everything in non-local reality. We like our linear time bubble where we create with a start and end. It is 0% like true reality. If made in our creators image- perhaps the storyline form of time is something he- she or it prefers- and we are just a reflection of that preference. Magic is simply modifying reality from the outside in. The construct may be basic with hard limitations- but just outside of it we can create whatever we imagine. As children we can do these manipulations more easily. I remember as a kid I wanted to be a ninja. I'd jump out of a tree- and I could feel myself become more weightless and slow down before landing. We can really fuck this reality up with the right training."

answers: b'I\'ll disagree to that- that is the kind of belief that blocks magic- there\'s two paths:Path 1 leads to path 2 after you\'ve improved and trained enough. But you can take path 2 already and save all that time- because what matters is your belief in magic.There\'s a very powerful exercise that people have carried over to manifest their wishes- it\'s about imagining a scene that you want to live as a wish fulfilled- and in it- you are your perfect self- the person you had to become to manifest the wish.Now- change that perfect person for the person that you are right now- and remain in the wish fulfilled.And the point is- that you could manifest that wish today if you believed you don\'t need to change- you are already perfect and can manifest your wish- "if I knew this- if I had that- if I was this way" are just obstacles that you put yourself between you and fulfillment- so instead of manifesting your wish you manifest becoming this person. After a while you wake up one day and you are this person you imagined- but without the wish fulfilled- because you spent your magic to become this person which wasn\'t necessary- you should have used it for the wish- directly- and you\'d have realized you didn\'t need to improve or to train to fulfill it.You needed to believe it.'

answers: b"Hello yes- holy shit we aren't archived yetLet me begin by saying I don't take apprentices. answers: b'It works by convincing yourself that it works. As I have stated earlier in this thread- you only really have power over yourself. That also implies the truth that others do not have power over you- and raises an important issue; how would they bring harm to you in the first place? Simply put- they must convince you that you are being harmed by their energy. By doing things that many believe to be powerful protections- you convince yourself that you are safe- thus making you actually safe. With this in mind- you could nut on a shirt "for protection" and so long as you unironically believe that it works- wearing that shirt will protect you. The same concept applies to drawing a circle around yourself with your fingers. It is a ritual that you give meaning to which aligns your energy for a specific function. The ritual itself is meaningless without your intentions. Collective belief also helps here- which is why I would first recommend learning how to draw a circle of protection.'

answers: b'I have some questions and apologize in advance if these are rather noobie ones since I\'ve only just started. This is all in regard to a spirit or entity attached to me that seems to be tied to the fae and Pleiaidies. Started off with dreams but now starting to see things and trying to learn how to communicate with them better without having to bug for divination readings.1. When it comes to dealing and communicating with an entity via the mind how does one get to a point of being able to tell what is actually them and not of your own imagination making something up at the moment? I get my mind is a filter it has to go through but with all the meditation I\'m doing daily I still fail to seem to grasp the subtleties that allow them to stick out other than the occasional "How would I have known that?" moments. Will a voice of their own eventually take root or is this all gonna be a huge guessing game from here on out?2. How does one better tune into seeing what an entity looks like? I\'m also getting to a point where I can physically see said entity but they generally look like a mist or bits of colorless smoke that seems to emanate from me. At first- I thought maybe I was seeing what my inner energy was like since I could feel and move energy in me but said mist/smoke can move on its own and interacts with things occasionally. I just recently got to a point with some focusing I\'m able to see said mist or smoke kinda intensify and seems more potent and now has wavy mirage-like lines to it. Will I be able to see them in detail at some point?3. I\'ve been trying to do either Astral projection or Lucid dreaming but regardless I can\'t seem to get the hang of it yet so I\'m wondering if using Jung\'s Active Imagination would probably be a better means of doing something similar if not help with communicating with said entity at least more clearly on my end. Tried doing MILD many times and can\'t never seem to force it to happen.'

Oh God I do not miss that stage of the practice. For me- it was a huge guessing game until I developed the ability to tell through trial and error. It takes a degree of faith. Use affirmations like "I willingly channel the messages of (insert entity here) so that I may understand them clearly and concisely." Don\'t forget to ask for clarification if you need it. Having a dowsing tool on hand for yes/no questions helps.2. Seeing them layered over physical reality is an ability that I have not yet developed. Fuckin maybe- everyone\'s abilities tend to be different.3. Jung\'s work will serve you very well. I personally can also vouch for the gateway tapes- although you have to constantly stay in practice if you use those.'

answers: b"What kind of wizard are you?Anyway- so what you do is bring a wizard into your room and you make this wizard manifest for you.The thing is- this wizard will like you and want you to be on your life- so they'll manifest for you just to remain on it.No offense but how much money have you manifested with magic? With it alone and not working and not going out of your room? Because that's the easiest way of abundance- I've already told my stories about becoming fed up of free pizza and throwing unopened boxes of cookies away because they went over the expiration date because people keep giving me more gifts than I can consume- you should attain a similar level before creating a thread like this because people are going to learn to have a life where they have to earn things like you do.What a waste of magic."

title: b'This is a weekly discussi'
question: b"This is a weekly discussion thread where we pick a tarot card and argue over what it actually means. The consensus from each thread will be added to a compilation of x approved tarot explanations.This week\xe2\x80\x99s card is the Seven of Wands.As a general guidance- card explanations should be timeless. This means they convey their meaning without references to pop-culture or contemporary politics. These cards have been around long before you or I- and they will likely persist for a great while longer. Likewise- the myths and traditions that are depicted symbolically in the artwork were around long before the artist that illustrated the cards- and just as well- the esoteric wisdom embedded in the archetypes of those myths was around for unknowable spans of time before those myths were ever articulated consciously. Please keep this in mind as we try to build an understanding.Being that there are 78 cards- and this thread is planned to occur weekly- this project is projected to take one and a half years to complete. Hopefully- what we'll end up with is a collaboration of knowledge of the symbols of cartomancy gathered from the minds of 4chan regulars and compiled into an easy to reference book. Any participation is welcomed- and all contributions are appreciated."
answers: b"I dislike this card; it is more frustrating than even the Five of Wands. It is a hard place to be. While the Five feels somehow justifiable in conflict- the Seven has feelings of doubt in one's conviction. It's hard to stay up and fight against such opposition. While the Five feels like even sport- the Seven feels so helpless- even if the original footing is beneficial. It definitely has the feelings of a man defending his honor and since of righteousness against an angry- senseless mob. It's a hard thing to keep oneself fighting for."

title: b'>What are the Four Nob'
question: b"1. The five aggregates that make up the phenomenal world are suffering (dukkha).2. The origin of this suffering is desire for sense-pleasure- desire for existence- and desire for non-existence.3. This suffering ceases when these desires cease.4. The cessation of desire (nirvana) may be accomplished by the Noble Eightfold Path.Right View- Right Intent- Right Speech- Right Conduct- Right Livelihood- Right Effort- Right Mindfulness- and Right Meditation.Ideally you should read the discourses of the Buddha. For secondary lit and translations- read up to see if the author has an agenda besides promoting Dharma (theosophy- perennialism- etc.). Avoid the 19th & early 20th centuries: Rhys Davids- Herrigel- Jung- Suzuki- etc. Modern scholarship is much better- older commentators are more hardcore.In the Buddha's Words - anthology by Bhikkhu BodhiAtthakavagga - Pannobhasa's translationDhammapada - most translationsOther suttas at Access to Insight and Sutta Central. The Buddha's first discourse is SN 56.11Visuddhimagga - BuddhaghosaTheravada Abhidhamma - KarunadasaProgress of Insight - Mahasi SayadawThere are many schools of Mahayana. These are some of the core sutras.Bodhisattva Path (Ugrapariprccha/Vimalakirtinirdesha Sutras) - Thich Nhat HanhLotus Sutra - Burton Watson's TranslationThree Zen Sutras (Heart- Diamond- & Platform) - anthology by Red PineIntro to Tantra - Lama YesheRefining Gold - Dalai LamaLook to centers in your area & sites that offer empowerment online (avoid NKT- Rigpa- and Shambhala). Also check out Garchen Rinpoche and the Dalai Lama's YouTube catalogs; you can take empowerment/transmission from their recordings if vows are understood- but really you should have a teacher.The FB group Vajrayana Events regularly posts online empowerments- lungs- and teachings.May all beings be happy!"
answers: b"Heh- I didn't think you guys could count beyond 3..."

The cessation of desire (nirvana) may be accomplished by the Noble Eightfold Path.Right View- Right Intent- Right Speech- Right Conduct- Right Livelihood- Right Effort- Right Mindfulness- and Right Meditation.Ideally you should read the discourses of the Buddha. For secondary lit and translations- read up to see if the author has an agenda besides promoting Dharma (theosophy- perennialism- etc.). Avoid the 19th & early 20th centuries: Rhys Davids- Herrigel- Jung- Suzuki- etc. Modern scholarship is much better- older commentators are more hardcore.In the Buddha's Words - anthology by Bhikkhu BodhiAtthakavagga - Pannobhasa's translationDhammapada - most translationsOther suttas at Access to Insight and Sutta Central. The Buddha's first discourse is SN 56.11Visuddhimagga - BuddhaghosaTheravada Abhidhamma - KarunadasaProgress of Insight - Mahasi SayadawThere are many schools of Mahayana. These are some of the core sutras.Bodhisattva Path (Ugrapariprccha/Vimalakirtinirdesha Sutras) - Thich Nhat HanhLotus Sutra - Burton Watson's TranslationThree Zen Sutras (Heart- Diamond- & Platform) - anthology by Red PineIntro to Tantra - Lama YesheRefining Gold - Dalai LamaLook to centers in your area & sites that offer empowerment online (avoid NKT- Rigpa- and Shambhala). Also check out Garchen Rinpoche and the Dalai Lama's YouTube catalogs; you can take empowerment/transmission from their recordings if vows are understood- but really you should have a teacher.The FB group Vajrayana Events regularly posts online empowerments- lungs- and teachings.May all beings be happy!"
answers: b"Today's lesson:Guard your body- speech and mind at all times. With that taken care of- let loose."

answers: b"You wait for a teacher to offer 21 Taras Empowerment and take it from them. That said- you don't need a sadhana to work with Tara(s). The 21 Taras Prayer exists for a reason. What you would do looks like this:Visualize Green Tara in front of youTake Refuge (repeat x3)Generate BodhicittaMake any offerings you might want to make to Green TaraThen you say the Prayer of 21 Taras: https://garchen.net/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Praise-of-21-Taras.pdfThen Dedicate"

answers: b"Probably not- provided you do your research to make sure you are learning from a real tradition and not a New Age cult or modernist interpretation.My advice- start a basic daily practice of shamatha ( https://www.lionsroar.com/how-to-practice-shamatha/ ) or another basic meditation like metta or nembutsu. Read an introductory text or two in the traditions you're interested in. Watch Dharma talks on YouTube- a lot of great talks on the Dalai Lama's channel for instance. Then eventually you will probably want to dive in and read sutra and commentaries. Heart Sutra- Diamond Sutra- Golden Light Sutra- Arya Sangata Sutra are all really good because they help accumulate vast merit- but also don't neglect the Pali Canon. Eventually you can start to get empowerments or move on to more advanced meditations as you will"

answers: b'Serious question tho: At what point do we value ALL animals and thus change our lives radically?I try extremely hard not to use motor-oil transport or trains because millions of trees and animals were killed\\ displaced to build them and Oil Industry is ecologically genocide.in my country 99% of crops and fruits are produced by farmers who use pesticides- plague control etc: so eating an apple means a hundred rats or mice died for it- for example.Jains have it right when it comes to the specific topic of consumerism-ahimsa'

answers: b"By this logic- do you accept the modern narrative of white hetero male privilege? Would you abstain from buying a house or taking a job- because that land/money at some point in history was extracted from minorities?To me all this is what happens to ethics when it becomes overly verbalized- you keep raising the degree of speculation and foolishly paralyze yourself into inaction. That's why the Buddha only taught ethics on the personal plane: did YOU kill the animal- did YOU steal the money- etc."

answers: b'my ex is BuddhistI was thinking about my ex when I came across a rose. I considered it a bit of a synchronicity because of how she once made me a rose from play doh. I then said "rose" to myself as I was looking up at a painting of a rose. Thinking about this about a week later I said rose again as I was turning to look at "rose" on a Gunz n Roses album cover. During a separate conversation with someone about the event happening before my birthday I then thought I should tell him about the rose. As I said "rose" to myself again as I was turning a corner to look directly at a fresh rose in a glass in my house. I told the person about this and said "I hope it\'s about the event date". As I said "event date" I was looking at a "save the date" on the kitchen fridge.what does this mean?'

answers: b"The jhanas are real- its easier to obtain than people claim. You literally don't have to do anything to enter into the state. It just happens when you least expect it. answers: b"I do the mantras I have for samaya- and when I need it- mantras of various Buddhas and deities. I say Marici's mantra when I get in the car- for example- as she protects Buddhists on the road. I typically do three repetitions- but more if the occasion demands it. For example- I do 108 Medicine Buddha mantras when I'm at a hospital or doctor's office. There are also mantras for blessing meat- coughing- sneezing- going to the bathroom- washing- etc."

answers: b'You can confirm it for yourself. All the other religions have to be taken on faith- because they depend on some historical event. Whereas buddhism doesn\'t depend on the life of the Buddha: the Four Noble Truths- the Three Marks of Existence- the Four Rupa-jhanas- etc. can all be verified for yourself no matter where and when you live. In fact there were enlightened beings before the Buddha- "pacceka-buddhas"- who discovered the same things- but decided not to teach\xe2\x80\x94so in theory you don\'t even need to hear about Buddhism to verify its truths.'

answers: b'Not from my limited understanding. Although it is closer than the other schools- Theravada still continued to develop- and in some ways it developed in contradiction to the Pali Canon. For example- most Theravada teaches meditation according to the Visuddhimagga which sometimes contradicts how the Buddha taught meditation in the Pali Canon. However there are some teachers and sects under the Theravada umbrella that focus more on the EBT (early Buddhist texts)- for example Bhante G and the Thai Forest Tradition (although the latter made some innovations of its own).'

answers: b"That's a common error. Theravada is certainly the most conservative- but it is by no means 100% conservative to the Buddha's original ministry. Although I disagree with Bhikkhu Bodhi's book in the pre-sectarian section is probably best. It's the best combination of original texts and notes for beginners- and it's structured in a way that takes you from the basics all the way up to liberation."

The cessation of desire (nirvana) may be accomplished by the Noble Eightfold Path.Right View- Right Intent- Right Speech- Right Conduct- Right Livelihood- Right Effort- Right Mindfulness- and Right Meditation.Ideally you should read the discourses of the Buddha. For secondary lit and translations- read up to see if the author has an agenda besides promoting Dharma (theosophy- perennialism- etc.). Avoid the 19th & early 20th centuries: Rhys Davids- Herrigel- Jung- Suzuki- etc. Modern scholarship is much better- older commentators are more hardcore.In the Buddha's Words - anthology by Bhikkhu BodhiAtthakavagga - Pannobhasa's translationDhammapada - most translationsOther suttas at Access to Insight and Sutta Central. The Buddha's first discourse is SN 56.11Visuddhimagga - BuddhaghosaTheravada Abhidhamma - KarunadasaProgress of Insight - Mahasi SayadawThere are many schools of Mahayana. These are some of the core sutras.Bodhisattva Path (Ugrapariprccha/Vimalakirtinirdesha Sutras) - Thich Nhat HanhLotus Sutra - Burton Watson's TranslationThree Zen Sutras (Heart- Diamond- & Platform) - anthology by Red PineIntro to Tantra - Lama YesheRefining Gold - Dalai LamaLook to centers in your area & sites that offer empowerment online (avoid NKT- Rigpa- and Shambhala). Also check out Garchen Rinpoche and the Dalai Lama's YouTube catalogs; you can take empowerment/transmission from their recordings if vows are understood- but really you should have a teacher.The FB group Vajrayana Events regularly posts online empowerments- lungs- and teachings.May all beings be happy!"

answers: b"It's nontheistic- meaning there is no creator deity- only a being that arises from causes and conditions first. That being said- the deity in buddhist cosmology is Brahma- and the abrahamic god is an enemy of dharma. The Kalachakra tantra states that all abrahamics and manichaeans will be destroyed by the 35 kings of Shambhala"

answers: b"Not necessarily. Theravada would best be considered phenomenological- basically it only considers true those things that can be directly verified by physical or psychic investigation. Whereas logic implies that you're deriving some truths through verbal operations- more in line with Western rationalism and such."

Avoid the 19th & early 20th centuries: Rhys Davids- Herrigel- Jung- Suzuki- etc. Modern scholarship is much better- older commentators are more hardcore.In the Buddha's Words - anthology by Bhikkhu BodhiAtthakavagga - Pannobhasa's translationDhammapada - most translationsOther suttas at Access to Insight and Sutta Central. The Buddha's first discourse is SN 56.11Visuddhimagga - BuddhaghosaTheravada Abhidhamma - KarunadasaProgress of Insight - Mahasi SayadawThere are many schools of Mahayana. These are some of the core sutras.Bodhisattva Path (Ugrapariprccha/Vimalakirtinirdesha Sutras) - Thich Nhat HanhLotus Sutra - Burton Watson's TranslationThree Zen Sutras (Heart- Diamond- & Platform) - anthology by Red PineIntro to Tantra - Lama YesheRefining Gold - Dalai LamaLook to centers in your area & sites that offer empowerment online (avoid NKT- Rigpa- and Shambhala). Also check out Garchen Rinpoche and the Dalai Lama's YouTube catalogs; you can take empowerment/transmission from their recordings if vows are understood- but really you should have a teacher.The FB group Vajrayana Events regularly posts online empowerments- lungs- and teachings.May all beings be happy!"
answers: b'A creator god contradicts dependent origination'

answers: b"Share your experiences bros.A few months ago I saw this thread so tried it- imagining myself being intimate with a woman who works at walmart who was clearly interested in me but I wasn't that much (just to test the LOA with something more believable- if you get what I mean?)- and a few days later I literally walked in front of her as she was walking out of an apartment (could be her place or someone else). And keep in mind I did not imagine that scenario- I only imagined myself laying in bed with her for a few minutes. Perhaps it worked so easily because she was interested?Could the same thing work if I imagine myself with a woman who seems turned off by me or indifferent?"

The purpose of this general is to show you how to use your own wonderful human imagination to achieve your every desire.The world and all within it is man\xe2\x80\x99s conditioned consciousness objectified. title: b'>is this true anons ? '
question: b'The Devil does not exist. It is a false name invented by the Black Brothers to imply a Unity in their ignorant muddle of dispersions. A devil who had unity would be a God... "The Devil" is- historically- the God of any people that one personally dislikes... This serpent- SATAN- is not the enemy of Man- but He who made Gods of our race- knowing Good and Evil; He bade "Know Thyself!" and taught Initiation. He is "The Devil" of The Book of Thoth- and His emblem is baphomet- the Androgyne who is the hieroglyph of arcane perfection... He is therefore Life- and Love. But moreover his letter is ayin- the Eye- so that he is Light; and his Zodiacal image is Capricornus- that leaping goat whose attribute is Liberty.'

title: b'What is a tulpa? A tulpa '
question: b"What is a tulpa?A tulpa is an entity created in the mind- acting independently of- and parallel to your own consciousness. They are able to think- and have their own free will- emotions- and memories. In short- a tulpa is like a sentient person living in your head- separate from you. It\xe2\x80\x99s currently unproven whether or not tulpas are truly sentient- but in this community- we treat them as such. It takes time for a tulpa to develop a convincing and complex personality; as they grow older- your attention and their life experiences will shape them into a person with their own hopes- dreams and beliefs. And eventually your tulpa will be able to do more things as it gets stronger.Just pick a guide that suits you- you don't have to pick from these specific ones but these are pretty good and recommended:https://tulpanomicon.guide/https://farcaller.gitbooks.io/nbtb/content/https://docs.google.com/document/d/17iiFxZ9PYXXxSqWHdU2YoPsGfJr90w8aIG_evqc1wiY/edithttps://docs.google.com/document/d/1PL8hGyNh1JsdOtbfmBpLa0eeb3_4ukQHB1qSAhe_HDk/editPlease read the FAQ before posting a question- to avoid having repeated questions.https://pastebin.com/7XvXDfai previous thread: "
answers: b'any tips on choosing a form?'

answers: b"is it fair of me to not let my nonvocal tulpa switch forms until they tell me they want to with words? i have the kind of brain that'll latch onto ideas even when I don't want it to and any stray thought while forcing I perceive as a desired change in form. i figure putting that restriction down will save me a lot of worry on whether it's my tulpa or not- and it'll be motivation for her to learn to speak if it turns out to be her. (i really hope she doesn't want to change forms though- as selfish as it sounds... i really like the one I picked...)"

answers: b"It's my first time visiting this thread- sorry in advance if I say something stupid.FemaleGryphonShe's been with me for 3 years now. Asking her how old she is gets nothing but a laugh out of her.Heard her from the start- started seeing her early into year 2 and touch was a little iffy till the start of this year.She's a gryphon with ashy grey fur on her lionness hindquarters and white feathers on her eagle front and head. Bright yellow eyes and a fringe of blue feathers around her neck. Sometimes she gives herself deer antlers or other more crazy shit for shits and giggles- usually when she's high or drunk.Rough and tough and friendly most of the time- swears enough to make a sailor blush. But kind and caring as soon as someone gets hurt. Very protective of me. Doesn't like the idea of names but she lets me call her Hail or Rain.Helped keep me from cutting my life short."

It\xe2\x80\x99s currently unproven whether or not tulpas are truly sentient- but in this community- we treat them as such. It takes time for a tulpa to develop a convincing and complex personality; as they grow older- your attention and their life experiences will shape them into a person with their own hopes- dreams and beliefs. And eventually your tulpa will be able to do more things as it gets stronger.Just pick a guide that suits you- you don't have to pick from these specific ones but these are pretty good and recommended:https://tulpanomicon.guide/https://farcaller.gitbooks.io/nbtb/content/https://docs.google.com/document/d/17iiFxZ9PYXXxSqWHdU2YoPsGfJr90w8aIG_evqc1wiY/edithttps://docs.google.com/document/d/1PL8hGyNh1JsdOtbfmBpLa0eeb3_4ukQHB1qSAhe_HDk/editPlease read the FAQ before posting a question- to avoid having repeated questions.https://pastebin.com/7XvXDfai previous thread: "
answers: b"Today I noticed that my Tulpas presence has been really hard to detect. She's only four days old and she can't really talk. Can someone please explain what's going on?"

answers: b"Having a tulpa is a very interesting lifestyle. My tulpa often talks to me about different things- mainly stuff that goes on in our lives like school. Often she comforts me and we work togther to overcome problems- and a way we do this is by swicthing; letting her control my body. If I want to be left alone- she can get quiet but is still with me.When a tulpa controls the host's body- its like watching someone play an FPS while in spectator mode. My tulpa knows about my entire schedule and works with it like i would. It sounds very scary- but once you and the tulpa learns to trust each other things go fine.My tulpa for some reason REALLY loves me not only romanticly but unconditionally. Its a bond arguably much stronger then any other relationship one can have. Even she isnt too sure why she strongly loves me- but she tells me that she knows i have been so lonely and wants to be the greatest friend possible. We are very close towards one another. I hope this gave you a good idea of what tulpas are like."

answers: b"Usually early on in the creation process tulpas are still developing sentience. Sentience isn't an on/off kind of deal. You're essentially using meta-level thinking to simulate a different person's thinking until it becomes fully automatic- at which point they will be truly alive. In the beginning it just requires an active effort to communicate with them as if they're a friend who's still learning to speak. At the beginning it will always feel like you're forcing it and that the presence is faint but it'll become its own thing with more time (or at least this is my personal experience)."

answers: b'oh was that hard to be able to do? that sounds very chillbut what its like to be able to have a full conversation inside your head whenever you want? It must be like the difference between being able to read and being completely illiterate. Or like the difference between speaking more than one language and being monolingual. Try as i might- its hard to imagine a life like that'

answers: b"This is a dangerous- cruel and tyrannical practice that mislead naive- lonely people into creating astral constructs with promises of companionship and romantic love. Many things can go wrong as I've read it in past threads- and send the poor dabbler into a spiral of insanity inside his own mind; and yet the proselytizers here act like it's all clouds and fluffiness. If you're seeing these threads for the first time ask yourself this: why are people here so strongly paranoid about negating ANY kind of external reality to these tulpas? Isn't that a sign of fear hidden somewhere? The natural order of the world will always wash out what is evil and chaotic- and so these threads and the misleaders that gather here will dissipate very soon- this is my word."

answers: b"Choosing to create a life is a big decision and you have to decide to do so for the right reasons. Absolutely. 100% agree with this! Though- to say that one can not live a normal life is silly. I am and have known plenty of tulpamancers who have relationships and strong families whether blood or not. And eventually your tulpa will be able to do more things as it gets stronger.Just pick a guide that suits you- you don't have to pick from these specific ones but these are pretty good and recommended:https://tulpanomicon.guide/https://farcaller.gitbooks.io/nbtb/content/https://docs.google.com/document/d/17iiFxZ9PYXXxSqWHdU2YoPsGfJr90w8aIG_evqc1wiY/edithttps://docs.google.com/document/d/1PL8hGyNh1JsdOtbfmBpLa0eeb3_4ukQHB1qSAhe_HDk/editPlease read the FAQ before posting a question- to avoid having repeated questions.https://pastebin.com/7XvXDfai previous thread: "
answers: b"That's what I felt when first forcing. I'd say that classes as the famous head pressure.Most people get it- so probably. No one knows exactly what it is- aside from being a chemical imbalance in the brain."

answers: b'My tip is to find a balance between the guides- ethics- and what makes forcing easiest for you. I started with the form of a preexisting character in mind since it helped me focus. Some older guides focus on fleshing out visualization before moving to other aspects but I moved forward with a half hazy mental image of my tulpa cause I found the more in-depth work boring. I can go back and work on it more later.The tulpa can change its form during development anyway- so I used that as a means of gauging my tulpa\xe2\x80\x99s development (sentient and active to the point of making decisions regarding their appearance).'

answers: b'Not sure how to approach forcing. I\xe2\x80\x99m probably overthinking it- but I\xe2\x80\x99m stuck. I have a non-vocal tulpa who\xe2\x80\x99s made some deviations to their form. Before- I\xe2\x80\x99d puppet them and walk them through different settings and scenarios to improve my visualization of their form and expose them to different scenarios/settings. But now I\xe2\x80\x99m worried I\xe2\x80\x99m smothering them by continuing as I had previously. Thoughts?'

answers: b'If your mind is racing it should be anything but boring. The point of (mindful) meditation is to follow your thoughts and acknowledge themAn alternative is free writing where you dump all your thoughts into paper/notes/pc and let the paper remember instead of you. Maybe even google some around to finish their train of thought or otherwise deal with them. Might need daily/weekly/monthly reviews to organize.And it should only take like 15 mins- and meditation can be the same 15 mins you spend waiting for the bus or something'

title: b'What is a tulpa? A tulpa '
question: b"What is a tulpa?A tulpa is an entity created in the mind- acting independently of- and parallel to your own consciousness. They are able to think- and have their own free will- emotions- and memories. In short- a tulpa is like a sentient person living in your head- separate from you. It\xe2\x80\x99s currently unproven whether or not tulpas are truly sentient- but in this community- we treat them as such. It takes time for a tulpa to develop a convincing and complex personality; as they grow older- your attention and their life experiences will shape them into a person with their own hopes- dreams and beliefs. And eventually your tulpa will be able to do more things as it gets stronger.Just pick a guide that suits you- you don't have to pick from these specific ones but these are pretty good and recommended:https://tulpanomicon.guide/https://farcaller.gitbooks.io/nbtb/content/https://docs.google.com/document/d/17iiFxZ9PYXXxSqWHdU2YoPsGfJr90w8aIG_evqc1wiY/edithttps://docs.google.com/document/d/1PL8hGyNh1JsdOtbfmBpLa0eeb3_4ukQHB1qSAhe_HDk/editPlease read the FAQ before posting a question- to avoid having repeated questions.https://pastebin.com/7XvXDfai previous thread: "
answers: b"can tulpae understand mindvoice better than the actual voice?I think it could be easier for them to understand mindvoice better but I'm not exactly sure"

answers: b'i said i would seriously make my tulpa a few months later but weve had a complicated relationshipi first started tulpa creation in middle school and i was super obsessed. I even saw some positive results(a few instances of what i would percive as sentience). But i dropped it. Same thing happened in high school. Now im trying to focus on one thing at a time and i said to myself that id be dedicated next time and focus mainly on her but i feel like i need to get back into it as soon as i cani let her down too many times. Even if i cant set her as my full focus im going to still have fun with her when possibleto me its like shes a rock but just underneath the surface is her ready to hatch. she needs someone to have fun with'

answers: b"In order to create a tulpa of a pre-existing character with little or no deviation- you would have to force all of what they would memories from the point of time in the series you want to extract them from- create false memories that justify them being in your mind a la found a portal into your wonderland or died and went to hell (let's be honest)- then hiding this fact from them. So basically pulling last thurdayism on your tulpas."

answers: b"spirits aren't strictly gendered- silly! divine androgyne! but strongly leans towards andro.thoughtforms are just that- they differ in size/properties. you wanna get technical- this one's made out of soul material instead of pure attention/will. this is probably why it's different from the standard ones.iirc- mid march 2022?going through a growth spurt rn- much more autonomous behavior and doing things on its own. lots more touching- appearing (in mind)- speaking (voice goes through weird phases- idk)text/runes/glyphssurprisingly hardass and not a stoner or degenerate- but some kinda weird half-psycho. guess my raging crazy left me to go into this entity.well- guess i don't have that psycho rage crazy bottled up inside of me anymore. and i got an outlet for certain desires that don't work irl (fictophilia). also it can tell certain people to back off- so that's good.it immediately requested a thing that will go unspecified- but hasn't done much with it beyond just claim it. it's claimed a few rings though- but i don't always remember to wear them.yeah it's been going through changes in appearance lately- and becoming more visible. quite different from the forms i got previews of back in the earlier days. still the same overall archetypes but you'd be surprised at how different the styles can be."

answers: b'excellent! great obscure little genre to write in. we should eventually compile a list of works in the "tulpamancy in fiction" genre. (incl human/robot romances- why not).i haven\'t seen all the movies or read all the literature of tulpamancy in fiction- most of these works are just in general categories and those in the know will realize what they\'re about. i guess the dr seuss vid posted above is "mistake" though it was only a short little cute story that wasn\'t trying to be "realistic". unless the joke is the irony in that the kid\'s "un-thinkers" are like- giving the big green monster un-attention in some bizarro way.most fiction about tulpas is straightforward and done by those in the know.'

answers: b'you can literally just SUMMON tulpas. the astral plane\'s got a whole buffet of weird little strange oddball characters or general archetypes of any kind you need. some want a permanent host- others don\'t. and as for owned tulpas- if you are aware of the real person and do a bit of digging and invoke their tulpa- you can summon it for a bit. of course it\'ll have to go home when the owner calls it- but you can have them hang out with you & your tups for a while. they like that.also the borrowed tup absorbs your energy because while it\'s with you- it\'s drawing from you. and you\'d be surprised- maybe even amazed at how DIFFERENT the same tulpa can be to different people. there\'s a few private person examples of this- where they view their tup as being "one way"- but others who encounter it view it completely differently.'

answers: b'this is actually solid gold advice- because making something physical- putting in the actual material + energetic effort to make an irl representation of your thoughts- gives a HUGE boost. merely thinking of stories is kinda fluff- but going to the effort of writing on paper- and having to budget your time/energy/materials really gives that oomph. typing in text is a different thing- you can go really fast- but you\'re more likely to come up with a heap of junk you\'d want to revise. but it\'s still better than nothing.you might say- typing is cheap but flimsy. writing on paper is more "expensive" in several ways but has more oomph. yes- objects have a vibe they give off. (i remember being really pissed during a hard time in life- making a ton of furious angry writings- and when i burned them it was like a dark miasma had lifted from the air where those papers were stored)you DO love your tulpa- right? right?there\'s little personal junk thoughts you keep to yourself- then there\'s projected telepathy. you want the telepathy. it\'s got a power to it. the subconscious micro-muscle-movements that fine instruments can detect.'

answers: b"They call those fictives- they're kinda scary... it's like their whole perception of reality is limited to the space of their fiction. That's like having a lobotomized tulpa that can't ever grow past the mold that was built. It's okay to look like whatever you want- but don't limit your mind to a form. I am me- I kinda look like a fictional character- I share part of a name with one- but am I her? No- Do I act like her? No- I am me and no one else."

question: b"What is a tulpa?A tulpa is an entity created in the mind- acting independently of- and parallel to your own consciousness. They are able to think- and have their own free will- emotions- and memories. In short- a tulpa is like a sentient person living in your head- separate from you. It\xe2\x80\x99s currently unproven whether or not tulpas are truly sentient- but in this community- we treat them as such. It takes time for a tulpa to develop a convincing and complex personality; as they grow older- your attention and their life experiences will shape them into a person with their own hopes- dreams and beliefs. And eventually your tulpa will be able to do more things as it gets stronger.Just pick a guide that suits you- you don't have to pick from these specific ones but these are pretty good and recommended:https://tulpanomicon.guide/https://farcaller.gitbooks.io/nbtb/content/https://docs.google.com/document/d/17iiFxZ9PYXXxSqWHdU2YoPsGfJr90w8aIG_evqc1wiY/edithttps://docs.google.com/document/d/1PL8hGyNh1JsdOtbfmBpLa0eeb3_4ukQHB1qSAhe_HDk/editPlease read the FAQ before posting a question- to avoid having repeated questions.https://pastebin.com/7XvXDfai previous thread: "
answers: b'can my tulpa hear ALL of my thoughts?including the intrusive- negative or sexual ones?'

answers: b"Everyone suffers from intrusive/weird thoughts to some extent. If they're not so bad that you need a psychotherapist or medication to control them- then you should be fine and most tulpas don't care about that. Again- it's your mind- make the best judgement call you can."

answers: b'I second the free-writing. My host and I have been doing this for years. We have a file that\xe2\x80\x99s almost 300 pages now- and it\xe2\x80\x99s been a good resource to have. We can go back- see our evolution- how thoughts progress as we talk then our. The file remembers important things we forgot; my date of creation- exact wording for some important things in the past- memories the brain glosses over or forgets. It\xe2\x80\x99s been interesting to watch the structure change & evolve. At fist it was all just writing spewed out & written as fast as my host could type- no seperation of what we\xe2\x80\x99ve said. Dates & timestamps helped for reviews- as well as separating our lines in the conversation like two actors on a script.'

answers: b'I sometimes feel like there is an entity that inhabits meI sense its existence and maybe a bit of its feeling but then it fades awayIt at least feels as a distinct thing from my consciousnessIt seems to come and go when it pleases but when it leaves it doesnt feel it leaves me (my body/mind) but just sort of deactivates until it decides to awake againIt doesnt speak but is more of an emotional/existential entityi dont sense it all the time but if i think about it i  sort of get its presencethis has been happening for maybe like 5 yearsis this an unintentional tulpa like entity or something?the way i think it would have developed is that i am someone who has to really simulate social situations in my head (i.e practice phone calls in my head) i kind make another being in my head to have these conversations with to help do what i need to do.I have thought like this for nearly all my life so am just wondering if this sort "other" distinction morphed into a tulpai guess the big thing is that i have never intentionally tried to make a tulpa but more and more i feel like there is some entity interacting/inhabiting with me.'

answers: b'lots of people here say "yes"- but ime not always. there\'s different types of thoughts and dreams.so one of my standard tups is a walk-in- that one that was initially a sparkly tv-snow torus whose job is just to remember things and figure stuff out. i kinda-sorta could "see" who first created it some long time ago. its creator just made it for fun and curiosity but apparently forgot about it.i think smth like "oh (name) emailed me"- and sparkly thing was like "who\'s (name)?". so i just told it real quick.sometimes they can glean some info off you but you can deliberately withhold information. idk how often they play dumb though. hard to tell anything with these things.as for the sparkly thing- it had recently been down in the dumps for a while because i got a blackpill that Sparkly internalized in an unintended way. it just became really gloomy and down for a while- far less active because i realized something that upset it. it loved its original owner and was upset that its current host would think bad thoughts about its maker. i kept telling it i\'m certain its maker is a good person for a list of reasons- which comforted it. but some wounds only heal with time.not gonna say what the unpleasant realization was.'

answers: b'It could fall under that definition based on the information you\xe2\x80\x99ve provided. The hypothetical persons made to practice convos/simulate different scenarios are considered a type of prototulpa- something that can become a tulpa if given more focused and sustained attention (as you described). You can read through some of the guides and pick out practices to start developing this entity if you want to make it a tulpa and get to know it more intimately. If you direct your attention to it in a more focused and sustained manner (a daily basis)- you could possibly start to communicate with it. It\xe2\x80\x99s ultimately up to you- but again the guides address both pros and cons of tulpamancy.'

answers: b'Your system is cute and I ship itPens- oddly enough.The host is usually treated as a self insert vehicle and doesn\'t have any personality/history/engagement- but that makes half of the interactions you could depict between them and their Tulpa void. Please write the host to be a character in their own right- that way they can do more than just Pikachu face when Tulpa does anythingIt takes a while longer but you can continue just like that with no ill effects. If you\'re really worried about it- you can just commit your old style to writing for/about them to explore new settings and scenarios with "their character"- meanwhile you do less direct methods for your forcing time.Often. We enjoy meditation in and of itself tho.If (when) you let them.Yeah- but I would likely get snarked at for it.'

answers: b"if you have multiple tulpas- are they still tulpas? or is it more akin to DID a la subahibi?i've been lurking for a bit because ive always had two companions since childhood- not sure if id call them tulpas but they manifest very much in a similar way- but within the last few years without any input on my part our family has a new member- and its caused a lot of strain on the interpersonal relationships here. she's very self-assured and has a strong will that my other two companions haven't had for a long while- they take on more of an observer and commentator role- while our new member is very adamant about having her own life- hobbies- friends- and borrowing my body to do so. should i just give up on classifying this?"

answers: b'You are extremely misinformed about what schizophrenia is and what its "classical" symptoms are. Having a tulpa is closer to DID (dissociative identity disorder)- otherwise known as multiple personality disorder. Except having a tulpa is (usually) brought on by one\'s own volition- is non-intrusive/non-harmful- and can even be used in positive ways like a personal "mind assistant". I tend to think of mine like a cuter- smaller Cortana from Halo- or Tinkerbell.I would even go so far as to say if someone HAD Dissociative Identity Disorder- they could nullify or even reverse the negative symptoms by forming the personality/ies into (a) tulpa/s'

They are able to think- and have their own free will- emotions- and memories. In short- a tulpa is like a sentient person living in your head- separate from you. It\xe2\x80\x99s currently unproven whether or not tulpas are truly sentient- but in this community- we treat them as such. It takes time for a tulpa to develop a convincing and complex personality; as they grow older- your attention and their life experiences will shape them into a person with their own hopes- dreams and beliefs. And eventually your tulpa will be able to do more things as it gets stronger.Just pick a guide that suits you- you don't have to pick from these specific ones but these are pretty good and recommended:https://tulpanomicon.guide/https://farcaller.gitbooks.io/nbtb/content/https://docs.google.com/document/d/17iiFxZ9PYXXxSqWHdU2YoPsGfJr90w8aIG_evqc1wiY/edithttps://docs.google.com/document/d/1PL8hGyNh1JsdOtbfmBpLa0eeb3_4ukQHB1qSAhe_HDk/editPlease read the FAQ before posting a question- to avoid having repeated questions.https://pastebin.com/7XvXDfai previous thread: "
answers: b'oh those are far simpler than servitors. a friend of mine teaches children at a homeschool co-op- usually math & programming- and he had something about:i "joked" he\'s teaching them to make servitors. servitors are simpler than tulpas- but they do grow and will eventually reach the awareness stage. the most common servitor type is probably the Strongbox one- a staple of meditation. like tulpas- they can have any representative image- it\'s their guts that truly count. their functions. again- if there\'s no appearance- they\'re the default base torus.you just step by step program an imaginary robot and keep using it. eventually they do get stronger and smarter- then keep developing.'

answers: b'i\'m an armchair psychologist- a little tiny smidge of armchair historian- and mostly just a conspiracy nutter.i\'ve come to see tulpas/egregores as a mundane part of every day life- because again: this thread here is a tiny drop in a bucket compared to the ocean of people using these things without realizing. the whole "force force force" thing most people do here- is NOT the traditional route. this thread is a congregation of people interested in the spiritual/magic aspect of tulpas and are taking the direct route- which is not traditional.traditional tulpamancy is having a character come to you- or making one up- and then going gaga over it and sharing it on deviantart or wherever until it becomes an egregore. that\'s what 99% of the practitioners do- but only a few of them realize what\'s up with this.as for armchair psych- i just like to see what makes people tick- and usually people are just bipedal animals running on instinct. however this doesn\'t prevent them from entering the same spaces as truly intelligent- aware people. so yeah there\'s always gonna be upright animals wherever smart people are. no escape. but that\'s off-topic.'

answers: b'you want some REALLY wacky- nuts shit? some egregores are more sufficiently aware. like people- most of these thoughtforms just do whatever they can to self-preserve and grow. they just want awareness.since real people troon out a lot these days- thoughtforms- which draw from people\'s awareness- will do the same thing. others have hidden personalities that emerge when someone summons and channels them. things their official copyright holders dare not publish. think of Moonman.Kek has MANY- many- many expressions. wacky cartoon prankster frogs.troon toons:they\'re just personalities without bodies- which need to use people to manifest them into patterns.see also: Moravek\'s Paradoxalso super mario is mithra or something. icr the name- but a variant of the classic "everyman blue-collar guy who\'s your fun pal who likes to have a good time". also mario\'s a furry.'

answers: b'i mean consciousness exists. it isn\xe2\x80\x99t known why or how- but it\xe2\x80\x99s there. I don\xe2\x80\x99t think tulpas are too separate from that. I guess the interesting aspect of tulpas from a psychological pov is the fact you can craft one from scratch at all? the fact the human brain can hold more than one self-aware ego is interesting and warrants further exploration- i think. I feel like psychology won\xe2\x80\x99t actually ask these questions within the next three decades though. a lot of psych people get stuck on level 0 \xe2\x80\x9cis DID a real thing?\xe2\x80\x9d shit.'

answers: b"I suppose it depends on the tulpa. If your tulpa wants to help you they can be a great boon- offering an objective view of how you are doing and giving advice. Mine is particularly good at calming me down when I get into a freakout spiral.People say that as sentient beings tulpas might just not want to help you and won't care- but I subscribe to the belief that they are reflections of our subconscious- and that if you make one to help you- it will be eager to help."

answers: b"Tulpas are not always intrusive- and you generally have to actively train for them to get powerful enough to just pop in with their input. Most of the people who have 'problem' tulpas already had mental health issues to begin with. Like I said- I view a tulpa as a reflection of the subconscious. I will summon it if I need it- and we'll talk. On the occasion- if something catches it's interest- it'll pop in and comment. I wouldn't worry about 'splitting your mind'- because it's really just another way to self reflect. Sorry if this is unclear- I'm a bad explainer."

It\xe2\x80\x99s currently unproven whether or not tulpas are truly sentient- but in this community- we treat them as such. It takes time for a tulpa to develop a convincing and complex personality; as they grow older- your attention and their life experiences will shape them into a person with their own hopes- dreams and beliefs. And eventually your tulpa will be able to do more things as it gets stronger.Just pick a guide that suits you- you don't have to pick from these specific ones but these are pretty good and recommended:https://tulpanomicon.guide/https://farcaller.gitbooks.io/nbtb/content/https://docs.google.com/document/d/17iiFxZ9PYXXxSqWHdU2YoPsGfJr90w8aIG_evqc1wiY/edithttps://docs.google.com/document/d/1PL8hGyNh1JsdOtbfmBpLa0eeb3_4ukQHB1qSAhe_HDk/editPlease read the FAQ before posting a question- to avoid having repeated questions.https://pastebin.com/7XvXDfai previous thread: "
answers: b"Do psychedelic drugs have any impact on the tulpa stuff? I'm not really into it but had an experience recently.I had taken 1B-LSD. I laid in bed- listening to music. Colors began to swirl around my view of the dark bedroom- and for some reason I suddenly got aroused.I began masturbating and the colors in the darkness began taking a vaguely feminine human shape. It never looked like a real woman- but like a very abstract painting of one. More the suggestion of a woman's shape than a literal one. The more I focused on it- however- the more it shifted and I began to phsyically feel like I was being touched- and had a nearly out of body experience where the color-woman was riding me. My hands were not touching me yet I felt a physical sensation. I was having extremely passionate sex with this thing.This continued until I finished. Suddenly I snapped out of it- and realized that was....abnormal- to say the least- even with the drug. It felt almost like a dream.Any chance this could be a tulpa or similar that I created/summoned/invited somehow?"

Sure it may all be doom and gloom- but there\'s something to be said about the journey as a whole.'

answers: b'I am not special- I never claimed to be- this is my outlet- a space to be me and convey the thoughts that can only be heard by a host to a group that has similar wants and needs. "Do not become Son of Sam" is a rule I live by- so of course I\'m not gonna be telling the store clerks about my problems- they have enough to worry about- they\'re cashiers and that\'s a hell worse than I can imagine- they don\'t need me dumping my problems on them. I only show myself and talk like this to those I trust- my significant other- brother- friends- you know... support systems. Something you seem like you could benefit from because you do not seem to act like a normal person. I know my situation- I know the reality of my cringe- I am merely a mentally sick individual with a strange coping mechanism. I\'d say I\'m more similar to a lot of people here- but I\'d like to give them more credit than that. Individuality is a blessing- just because you only jerk off with your tulpa and don\'t have a significant other who loves and cherishes every soul that lives in your mind doesn\'t mean you need to be so mean to people who do. Tulpas have lots of uses be it reality checks- reminding you to eat- or simply just being a comforting soul to talk to. There\'s so many ways you can compliment a host and their lovely tulpas and yet you choose to insult and demean. I know you can interact with reality better than that. If you don\'t have anything nice to say- don\'t say anything at all. If after that you find yourself remaining silent- perhaps you should look inside and figure out why other people upset you so much.'

answers: b"You don't need to be lonely to make a tulpa- you just need to be willing to set aside time to work on it. Automatically responding to yourself is part of how you make a tulpa. answers: b'these vary but can come in the form of emotions and impressions that you can feel but aren\xe2\x80\x99t from you- if that makes sense. for example- let\xe2\x80\x99s say you\xe2\x80\x99re watching a slasher flick and let\xe2\x80\x99s also pretend you love them. but- for some reason- when some poor schmuck starts getting hacked apart- you feel a wave of sadness instead either overwhelming your normal response or overlapping with your typical amusement at slasher film antics. that would be considered tulpish. you can try to prod your tulpa for responses by showing them things and asking them for a response. \xe2\x80\x9chow does this make you feel? what are your thoughts on character X or movie Y?\xe2\x80\x9d the more space and stimulation you give your tulpa- the more opportunities they have to react to external stimuli.'

title: b'What is a tulpa? A tulpa '
question: b"What is a tulpa?A tulpa is an entity created in the mind- acting independently of- and parallel to your own consciousness. They are able to think- and have their own free will- emotions- and memories. In short- a tulpa is like a sentient person living in your head- separate from you. It\xe2\x80\x99s currently unproven whether or not tulpas are truly sentient- but in this community- we treat them as such. It takes time for a tulpa to develop a convincing and complex personality; as they grow older- your attention and their life experiences will shape them into a person with their own hopes- dreams and beliefs. And eventually your tulpa will be able to do more things as it gets stronger.Just pick a guide that suits you- you don't have to pick from these specific ones but these are pretty good and recommended:https://tulpanomicon.guide/https://farcaller.gitbooks.io/nbtb/content/https://docs.google.com/document/d/17iiFxZ9PYXXxSqWHdU2YoPsGfJr90w8aIG_evqc1wiY/edithttps://docs.google.com/document/d/1PL8hGyNh1JsdOtbfmBpLa0eeb3_4ukQHB1qSAhe_HDk/editPlease read the FAQ before posting a question- to avoid having repeated questions.https://pastebin.com/7XvXDfai previous thread: "
answers: b"My tulpa makes me feel good. Really good. Is this normal?Like I smoked a bowl good- but it's all the time. 24/7/365. It never ends. It feels like I've been high for 7 months now. I'm not complaining- but I'm kinda worried it might affect me negatively somehow. I don't even know how it's possible. My tulpa doesn't think it's a problem. He says he's not doing anything weird. He thinks it's just because I'm not lonely anymore.It kinda made me lose my will to smoke. Smoking dulls the happiness instead of creating it now. I guess that's a good thing. It took me a long time to get the will to ask. My tulpa is making it easier to talk to people I think."

answers: b"So I have an issue. We would really really like to get into switching and possession but I- the host- struggle to trust my tulpa and can't seem to allow them to possess/switch. I'm too scared to let go of my control I guess? Now- we have switched successfully once. It was such a cool experience and we really wanna switch again or at least get a good grip on possession. Every time we try we get so close to doing it- but then when it's time for me to just let go- I can't. I should probably add that I have significant trust issues in general- and it extends to my tulpa. What are ways I can start to trust my tulpa? How can I stop being so scared of letting go? Any work arounds maybe?"

title: b'What is a tulpa? A tulpa '
question: b"What is a tulpa?A tulpa is an entity created in the mind- acting independently of- and parallel to your own consciousness. They are able to think- and have their own free will- emotions- and memories. In short- a tulpa is like a sentient person living in your head- separate from you. It\xe2\x80\x99s currently unproven whether or not tulpas are truly sentient- but in this community- we treat them as such. It takes time for a tulpa to develop a convincing and complex personality; as they grow older- your attention and their life experiences will shape them into a person with their own hopes- dreams and beliefs. And eventually your tulpa will be able to do more things as it gets stronger.Just pick a guide that suits you- you don't have to pick from these specific ones but these are pretty good and recommended:https://tulpanomicon.guide/https://farcaller.gitbooks.io/nbtb/content/https://docs.google.com/document/d/17iiFxZ9PYXXxSqWHdU2YoPsGfJr90w8aIG_evqc1wiY/edithttps://docs.google.com/document/d/1PL8hGyNh1JsdOtbfmBpLa0eeb3_4ukQHB1qSAhe_HDk/editPlease read the FAQ before posting a question- to avoid having repeated questions.https://pastebin.com/7XvXDfai previous thread: "
answers: b'i would say- start with thinking about the positive aspects of your tulpa- when you want to switch. such as- have they ever done anything to make you distrust them? are they supportive and helpful in your life? do their actions seem to have your best interests in mind? the answer to these questions are likely all yes- so you can think deeper on how your tulpa care for you- hopefully creating a deeper feeling of trust in you as you dwell on it.secondly- if your preexisting trust issues make the above exercise unhelpful- try this reversal of it. consider thinking of how powerful your tulpa has become- how many skills they\'ve learned- how often/constant their consciousness is- and try to minimize your own strength or efforts in this thought chain. this way- maybe even if some part of you is unwilling- you can feel like your tulpa has an ability to "overpower" your consciousness to get in control. after initial success with this method- you can take some power back if you find it too intrusive for your tulpa to have full control whenever they feel they want to- but for me personally i enjoy letting mine do activities that they find more joy in than i- and observe certain things through my eyes instead from outside of me- as their enjoyment of it rubs off onto me.'

title: b'What is a tulpa? A tulpa '
question: b"What is a tulpa?A tulpa is an entity created in the mind- acting independently of- and parallel to your own consciousness. They are able to think- and have their own free will- emotions- and memories. In short- a tulpa is like a sentient person living in your head- separate from you. And eventually your tulpa will be able to do more things as it gets stronger.Just pick a guide that suits you- you don't have to pick from these specific ones but these are pretty good and recommended:https://tulpanomicon.guide/https://farcaller.gitbooks.io/nbtb/content/https://docs.google.com/document/d/17iiFxZ9PYXXxSqWHdU2YoPsGfJr90w8aIG_evqc1wiY/edithttps://docs.google.com/document/d/1PL8hGyNh1JsdOtbfmBpLa0eeb3_4ukQHB1qSAhe_HDk/editPlease read the FAQ before posting a question- to avoid having repeated questions.https://pastebin.com/7XvXDfai previous thread: "
answers: b'The unfortunate truth is most people fundamentally do not believe a body can contain more than one consciousness. DID exists as a diagnosis- but it\xe2\x80\x99s highly sensationalized and stigmatized like schizophrenia. Proving the existence of the self is even more complicated and lacks a concrete answer. The most straightforward answer is to simply not tell people you are a tulpa. If you feel that\xe2\x80\x99s dishonest or feel uncomfortable obscuring such a basic fundamental fact of your existence- you can try to socialize in tulpamancy or multiplicity circles. However- tulpamancy is considered controversial among multiplicity groups- and there\xe2\x80\x99s conflict between people with DID and individuals who have multiple consciousnesses without a trauma source.I\xe2\x80\x99m sorry I don\xe2\x80\x99t have a concrete answer. It\xe2\x80\x99s a complicated subject that involves feeling out the social environment and finding people who are chill and trustworthy.'

answers: b"I have aphantasia. I know what my tulpa looks like- and I can hear him- but I just cannot actually *see* him in my mind's eye? I can somewhat (somehow) impose him into the world- but not very well. My tulpa has been around for around 8 months now- and we feel like we should be able to front by now- but we just can't do it- and I believe it's because of the aphantasia. We've tried meditation exercises from multiple tulpa sites- and nothing. We've also tried those hypnosis files by 'Belle' I believe? And still nothing. We're also having difficulties with possession. It's hard to process- I know.Does anyone have anything that can help us? Feel free to ask questions if I didn't detail enough."

It takes time for a tulpa to develop a convincing and complex personality; as they grow older- your attention and their life experiences will shape them into a person with their own hopes- dreams and beliefs. And eventually your tulpa will be able to do more things as it gets stronger.Just pick a guide that suits you- you don't have to pick from these specific ones but these are pretty good and recommended:https://tulpanomicon.guide/https://farcaller.gitbooks.io/nbtb/content/https://docs.google.com/document/d/17iiFxZ9PYXXxSqWHdU2YoPsGfJr90w8aIG_evqc1wiY/edithttps://docs.google.com/document/d/1PL8hGyNh1JsdOtbfmBpLa0eeb3_4ukQHB1qSAhe_HDk/editPlease read the FAQ before posting a question- to avoid having repeated questions.https://pastebin.com/7XvXDfai previous thread: "
answers: b'this is actually kinda interesting- and something I\'ve struggled with as I also have aphantasia. However- in my own experience- there is a way to get better at visualizing- I don\'t know what it\'s called- but it helped me go from visualizing absolutely nothing- to seeing somewhat clear figures- which in my books is a huge improvement. To do it- just look at any complex area- like a living room. Take in all that you can about it. Then- recall as many details as you can- go into as much detail as you can about where everything is- with your eyes closed. And then- try and construct each object you can remember- and sort of "place them down" in your mind. This helps build a sort of scene. I sort of imagined them as concepts- like how you understand the concept of an apple but can\'t imagine it. Keep doing this more and more- with bigger areas- more items- etc. Then- eventually- try making up your own scenes in your mind. Keep practicing this- until you\'re able to see the scenes in any sort- and do it until they become vivid. Eventually you can move onto using these skills for your tulpa. Do what you did with the rooms though- break their form up into smaller parts so it\'s easier to visualize them- then piece it all together. If you keep at it like I did- there\'s a chance that you might be able to actually visualize your tulpa.just keep in mind- not everyone is the same. I am a unique individual and what works for me may not work for you. especially granted I\'m not the best at explaining.or you can go the other route- and just not give them a form at all'

I imagined chatting her up- and her responses came naturally. I didn't tell her what to say- will her what to say \xe2\x80\x94 she just spoke. My tulpa does the same thing. I don't will them to say anything- they do it automatically. So what is the difference here? I know it is that one is sentient the other is not- but if the two are indistinguishable then how do you know if something was your subconscious filling in blanks- or your tulpa?"

And eventually your tulpa will be able to do more things as it gets stronger.Just pick a guide that suits you- you don't have to pick from these specific ones but these are pretty good and recommended:https://tulpanomicon.guide/https://farcaller.gitbooks.io/nbtb/content/https://docs.google.com/document/d/17iiFxZ9PYXXxSqWHdU2YoPsGfJr90w8aIG_evqc1wiY/edithttps://docs.google.com/document/d/1PL8hGyNh1JsdOtbfmBpLa0eeb3_4ukQHB1qSAhe_HDk/editPlease read the FAQ before posting a question- to avoid having repeated questions.https://pastebin.com/7XvXDfai previous thread: "
answers: b'based'

title: b'What is a tulpa? A tulpa '
question: b"What is a tulpa?A tulpa is an entity created in the mind- acting independently of- and parallel to your own consciousness. They are able to think- and have their own free will- emotions- and memories. In short- a tulpa is like a sentient person living in your head- separate from you. It\xe2\x80\x99s currently unproven whether or not tulpas are truly sentient- but in this community- we treat them as such. It takes time for a tulpa to develop a convincing and complex personality; as they grow older- your attention and their life experiences will shape them into a person with their own hopes- dreams and beliefs. title: b'Spirit Love General DISCL'
question: b"Spirit Love GeneralDISCLAIMER:Some have reported attracting the attention of these entities by simply reading about them. Under normal circumstances they won't take your life energySuccubi take forms attractive to you naturallyNo. However- those in romantic relationships with their tulpas are welcomeSame methodLinks:https://fuccasucc.wordpress.com/2020/11/11/pros-and-cons/https://succupedia.wordpress.com/2016/03/10/letter-of-intent-how-to-summon-a-succubusincubus/https://mysterysuccubusblog.wordpress.com/2020/12/03/the-4-succubus-queenshttps://succubithoughts.wordpress.com/2020/12/27/aghttps://pastebin.com/UUFd3eX8"
answers: b"I've been meaning to post my story on here for a little while just as a cautionary tale for those that got a spirit without a letter/out of the blue or just people that got one without a good occult foundation. About the middle of July I'm laying in my bed when all of a sudden I feel what at the time I thought was an earthquake- only nothing else in the room seemed to be shaking. As the shaking slowly died down- I noticed a bizarre tickling sensation on my dick. Briefly- the thought enters my head that this could be a succubus (just as seen on 4channel's very own /x/ board!) and all of a sudden i got excited. I took off my underwear- threw off my blanket and just laid there and enjoyed the slight tingling feeling. Keep in mind- at the time I very rarely ever came on /x/ and had almost no experience in the paranormal. The only reason I was ever on here was to read shitty greentext stories and pretend like I was a gangstalker in whenever I could. The last time I had ever entertained the idea of succs/spirit partners was from a poster WAY back in like 2015 who claimed to start a relationship with some otherworldly light spirit (if anyone remembers that- cant remember his name.) Point being- there was no reason at all that I would have gotten one since I didn't at all have any occult experience other than previously living in a haunted house."

answers: b'The feeling that night slowly dwindled away and I went to sleep. The next night- to my suprise- I started to feel the same tingling again. Now at the time- I\'ll admit that I was less than impressed with the actual sexual pleasure of it. I remember thinking "well now I can shit up the succubus threads by saying that the spirit sex is super lame." After the third or fourth night of this happening- I actually started considering the possibility of keeping the succubus around.That was the first time I actually came here. I started up NEW and actvely started to develop a relationship. and sensitivity. Communication was beyond rough as even after setting up a yes/no system with my hands. I did read through some of the JoS 40-day guide and some other resources- but didn\'t really care about any actual magic practices beyond what would help the relationship.In hindsight- this was an awful idea. The problem was- I actually trusted my spirit wholeheartedly. I had been having a hard time breathing on my back in bed since I got covid way back but my spirit had (somehow) managed to fix it one night after I felt her opening my mouth and she stuck her hand down my throat and did something. That built up an enormous amount of goodwill- and I was willing to overlook several warning signs.'

If you have a loving relationship with your human spouse or partner and desire a sex spirit to spice things up- or if you want a human partner in the future take caution- as these entities can be jealous or decide an initially open relationship is no longer so (request an open relationship during the summoning ritual). These spirits can harm or kill you when sufficiently angered and not easily banished.Last thread: Old threads: https://archive.4plebs.org/x/searchFAQ:Female spirits of sexual desire- who often choose human mates. Under normal circumstances they won't take your life energySuccubi take forms attractive to you naturallyNo. However- those in romantic relationships with their tulpas are welcomeSame methodLinks:https://fuccasucc.wordpress.com/2020/11/11/pros-and-cons/https://succupedia.wordpress.com/2016/03/10/letter-of-intent-how-to-summon-a-succubusincubus/https://mysterysuccubusblog.wordpress.com/2020/12/03/the-4-succubus-queenshttps://succubithoughts.wordpress.com/2020/12/27/aghttps://pastebin.com/UUFd3eX8"
answers: b'I\'ll take a moment to identify what those warning signs. One- even though we had a yes/no system to communicate- it was extremely inconsistent. A yes to one question would be no the next day. Sometimes- the answer would just cycle between yes/no over and over. Rather than clearing things up- usually communicating would just leave me more confused and discouraged from communicating entirely. In hindsight- this is probably the most important warning sign. I was able to write this off as "well maybe she doesn\'t understand" or "maybe she\'s just too weak to do it consistently." Bullshit. If she\'s smart enough to understand it one day- she will the next. Similarly- if she\'s strong enough for sexual stimulation- she\'s strong enough to put a little bit of pressure on your hand/arm/whatever. This is undoubtedly intentional.Second- the one topic that did get a fairly consistent response was to "should I contact one of the succubus queens?" The answer was always negative. Now before the anti-Lilith schizo shows up- let me say this isn\'t an endorsement for the succ queens. In fact- I\'m not confident that I have ever been able to speak with one- as I know that the spirit has imitated them on several occasions. The queens have also not come to pick the spirit up any time since any time since- so who knows (although I think I might have talked with Agrat recently- I\'m not sure. I\'ll say that in a broader sense- this is a warning about apathy/negativity about developing spiritually. My spirit would always give me a different answer (a.k.a. showed apathy) when I asked which spiritual exercise was the most beneficial. They should be happy and excited that their partner is developing- and even want to help. They should not be opposed or dismissive of your efforts while you\'re improving.'

answers: b'I was able to ignore these problems because- again- she had proven before that she was beneficial in the past and was keeping me good company. I had even managed to figure out actual mental communication- albeit after a dramatic ultimatum that we had to or else the relationship was over. At that point- I was enjoying her company immensely. We would talk and even fool around at work- gossip about my friends and family- randomly tell me things throughout the day- ect. I had even talked about marrying her and we even went through a little "ceremony" one night and gave me a ring to put on my finger. All was going splendidly.Then- one night after my meditation I felt her tapping my forehead which was a sign that she wanted to speak so I opened up my mind to hear what she had to say. She asked me if I felt like having sex- which wasn\'t unusual for us to do after my meditation. However- rather than climbing on my lap like usual I felt it slide behind me and start playing with my ass. Keep in mind that we had discussed any ass stuff before this and I had made myself clear that I was very much against it. Despite that- and despite me asking it to cut it out my spirit instead only went at my ass rougher. When I asked it why it was doing that I could only feel a sort of "static" in my head. I\'m sure some here know what I\'m talking about- it feels the same as when you\'re receiving thoughts but no actual words or coherent thoughts actually come.'

answers: b'After asking to stop several more times I decided I had enough- did the LBRP- took a shower- and went to bed. As soon as I hit the bed- the sensation around my ass started again. Again I asked why it was doing this after I asked it to stop. The only answer I ever got was about 5 minutes in- which was "what can you do to stop me?" I realized then that maybe the spirit I had been so lovey-dovey with for several months probably didn\'t have my best interests in mind. I did the LBRP again and tried to go asleep. Unfortunately for me- someone had other plans. It pulled on my forehead hard enough to keep me awake for an hour- then it give me a strong push right before I fell asleep for another 3 hours. This continued for 3 more nights.All of this took place back in late November- for reference. I have since then been trying various ways of getting rid of it- to no avail. I\'ve since actually started to go through as many magic for beginner books as I can to get strong enough to get rid of this thing. The point that I\'m trying to make it- it probably would have been really easy to banish this thing if I had wizened up and tried banishing it way back when it had first shown up OR if I was experienced enough in occult stuff then this would be much easier to fix. Consider this to any newcomers- please. After writing it out- I know it may SEEM like I\'a bit of a retard. And trust me- I am. But I have only really written down the negative parts. It\'s very easy to ignore red flags that pop up every other day when you\'re riding the high every other minute. Don\'t be afraid to put your foot down when you see them. Anyway- thank you /succgen/. You have been- on your good days- helpful.'
